etymology.description: 艹(艹) (cǎo, "grass") + 囷(囷) (jùn, "storing grains") = plant-related context + phonetic element -> fungus, bacterium, mushroom
etymology.interpretation: The character 简(菌) combines 艹(艹) for its semantic association with plants and fungi, and 囷(囷) as a phonetic component. This fusion suggests the growth or existence of fungi, fitting well with their natural habitat among vegetation.

examples.chinese: 这种菌可以用于发酵(這種菌可以用於發酵)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng jùn kěyǐ yòng yú fājiào.
examples.english: This fungus can be used for fermentation.

examples.chinese: 实验室培养出新型菌(實驗室培養出新型菌)，有望用于抗生素生产(有望用於抗生素生產)。
examples.pinyin: Shíyànshì péiyǎng chū xīnxíng jùn, yǒuwàng yòng yú kàngshēngsù shēngchǎn.
examples.english: A new type of fungus was cultivated in the laboratory, and it is expected to be used in antibiotic production.
